question: What are the documents required to be submitted before submission deadline? List all of them and indicate how to prepare these docs.
answer:
**Mentioned**  

**Documents required before the submission deadline and how to prepare them**

| # | Document | How to prepare / key requirements | Evidence |
|---|----------|------------------------------------|----------|
| 1 | **Expression of Interest (EOI) form – Annexure‑I** | Fill all fields in English (date of establishment, type of organisation, address, former name, narrative description, etc.). Attach the completed form to the online portal. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:8](chunkref://8) |
| 2 | **Undertaking – Annexure‑VI** | Sign the undertaking stating that all information in the EOI is true; sign digitally before uploading. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:13](chunkref://15) |
| 3 | **Experience details – Annexure‑IV** | Provide a table of past projects, client names, and attach copies of client certificates or letters of appreciation. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:11](chunkref://12) |
| 4 | **Client certificates / proof of completed assignments** | Attach scanned copies of certificates or letters from each client listed in Annexure‑IV. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:11](chunkref://12) |
| 5 | **Financial statements of the last five years** | Prepare audited financial statements (balance sheet, profit & loss, cash‑flow) in English; if any part is in another language, translate it and notarise the translation. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:9](chunkref://9) |
| 6 | **Letter of intent or existing agreement (if a joint‑venture)** | Attach a signed letter of intent or a copy of the existing JV agreement. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4) |
| 7 | **Translations of non‑English supporting documents** | Translate all non‑English documents into English; notarise each translation so that the translation is accepted. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4) |
| 8 | **Digital signature** | Digitally sign every PDF or document that is uploaded to the portal. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4) |
| 9 | **Online submission** | Upload each prepared document one by one through the e‑tender portal before the cut‑off date and time. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4) |

**Key preparation steps**

1. **Complete all forms in English** – the EOI and all supporting correspondence must be in English; non‑English documents must be translated and notarised.  
2. **Attach all supporting evidence** – experience certificates, financial statements, client letters, and any JV‑specific documents.  
3. **Digitally sign** every required document (EOI, undertaking, etc.) before uploading.  
4. **Upload each file individually** to the e‑tender portal as specified in the tender instructions; the portal will reject any submission that is not received online by the deadline.  

These documents and preparation steps are mandatory for a valid EOI; failure to submit any of them, or to submit them in the required format, will result in the EOI being rejected.

Republic of India — Instruction for submission of Expression of Interest 1. Consultant shall go through the guidelines provided under section‘I’and Section ‘II’before preparing EOI proposal.
2. Consultant who meet shortlisting criteria given in section ‘II’ shall prepare EOI as per the guidelines
given
in
section
I.
If
the
Consultant
desires
to
submit certain information not covered in the guidelines would be in his interest, he
may submit such information.
3. The Application shall be the basis for drawing up a shortlist of eligible consultants who willbeinvitedtosubmitproposalforservicesrequired.
4. All Applications shall be submitted in English.
5. If the EOI is submitted by a Joint Venture, attach a letter of intent or a copy of an existing agreement.
6. The EOI and all related correspondence and documents should be written in the English language.Supporting documents and printed literature furnished by Applicant with the
EOI may be in any other language provided that they are accompanied with translations
in the English language.Supporting materials,which are not translated into English,may
not be considered.For the purpose of interpretation and evaluation of the EOI,the
English language translation shall prevail. The translated documents from any other
language to English language shall be notorised.
7. The Applicant shall provide all the information sought under this shortlisting Criteria.Central
Water
Commission
would
evaluate
only
those
EOI
thatarereceivedintherequiredformatandcompleteinallrespects.Incomplete and / or conditi
onal EOI shall not be considered for short listing.
8. Detailed ToR will also be available on website www.damsafety.in
9. No EOI whatsoever will be entertained if submission is not received online by due date andtime.
10. The Consultant has to digitally sign and upload the required bid documents one by one asindicatedinthetenderdocument.
